meanings.definition: To bring back to life or existence.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a special serum to resurrect the plant that had withered away.
meanings.sent2: The community came together to resurrect the old library and turn it into a vibrant community center.
meanings.sent3: After the power outage, the technician had to resurrect the computer by restarting it.
meanings.sent4: The rain helped resurrect the dried-up river, bringing life back to the surrounding ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The magical spell was able to resurrect the ancient statue, making it appear as good as new.

meanings.sent1: The rain helped resurrect the wilted flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The new marketing campaign was able to resurrect interest in the old product.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes never failed to resurrect laughter from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The music from her childhood was able to resurrect memories of happier times.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk was able to resurrect the team's fighting spirit.

meanings.sent1: In the movie, the evil sorcerer tried to resurrect an army of zombies to do his bidding.
meanings.sent2: Legends say that a powerful artifact has the ability to resurrect the deceased.
meanings.sent3: The Halloween costume contest featured a creative zombie makeup that looked like it could resurrect the dead.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ritual was believed to have the power to resurrect the pharaohs from their tombs.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure seemed to have the ability to resurrect the spirits of the departed.
